title: Bring back seeing other's ping...
body:
So  you know when people are always complaining that they are lagging in game, but sometimes they are not they are just making bad mistakes and feeding.
We should be able to see someones ping in the loading screen again so that people can't talk shit to people who are actually lagging. 
Everyone would be able to see it.

replies.body: Ping spikes can happen DURING the game, just because your ping is okay at the loading screen doesn't mean you won't get a massive 1k ping spike during the game

> Ping spikes can happen DURING the game, just because your ping is okay at the loading screen doesn't mean you won't get a massive 1k ping spike during the game

Yea, but some people lag, BEFORE GAME also and if the ping number stays under the persons summnors icon during the game then we can see if they are lagging or not.

Still isn't a good idea. For example the enemy team could see that somebody is lagging and decide to get feed off them, if they didn't know they were lagging they could assume they are trying to get their lane pushed, playing safe or other stuff
I'm not for one to bring back the ping system OP wants back on loading screen, but I bet Riot could just show ping only to teammates like they do with ranked borders.
Sure so you can attack your own teammates because that's what riot wants you to do right?

I have an average of 40 ping but for whatever reason i get massive spikes every 5-10 seconds that make it impossible to play the game (even happens in solo custom games). Support has been useless to fix this btw which sucks i havent been able to play for 3 months. My point is that seeing ping in the loading screen wont really help with this. Besides the people who dont believe someone is actually lagging are just going to rage at them for playing with high ping in the first place.
riot should for sure bring this back, this is a great idea!

"Hey guys, Talon must be an East coaster, he has 112 ping! Free win."
"Dude why'd you pick Cassiopeia if you have 100+ ping? [All] Report Cass please."

> "Hey guys, Talon must be an East coaster, he has 112 ping! Free win."
> "Dude why'd you pick Cassiopeia if you have 100+ ping? [All] Report Cass please."

I run every single game I play with 140 ping and it works smooth for me. 
So thats just assuming something and its also quite silly you would think that.
Yep I normally have ~130 ping and everything is just fine. Now if I was competing competitively yes it would be an issue but not for normal queue and regular ranked matches.

You should try playing at 70 ping or lower, I usually am at 112 ish ping but on PBE I usually get closer to 70 and i gotta say it makes you feel darn near invincible, skillshots are easier, insec plays are easier, dodging skill shots is FAR easier. It's amazing.
Or this could be one of the long list of things Rito can put in as toggle options.  I do like to see if people are actually "lagged" out or making excuses.

Maybe instead of making both teams see it, we just let our team see only for our team it would also help in team fights because you can see the ping spike and be like nope right now is not a good time our adc just shot up to 300 ping lets back off for a few min guys. i never said both teams should see it but it would really help if our team could.
If they did that, they'd leave when they saw me loading. 400 ping op.

Its NA server.
Everyone has shit connection.
Only reliable server is CN/KR because they don't like foriengers in(you have to go through multiple hoops to play if you want to play there...basically)
If we had that and barred our stuff to only NA we'd have no lag since no extra stress.
Instead we still have millions of extra baggage slugging the server along after 5+ years the servers cant handle it.
Riots not upgrading.
People aren't leaving.

NA suffers.
It gets rid of people spamming to ban someone because their ping is 300+... I say leave it. AFKs and bad connections will happen regardless

One of the main problems with seeing others peoples ping is that if you, yourself have bad ping.. it will show everyone on your team has bad ping, when in fact its your problem

Its not accurate

I just miss being able to poke fun at my friend who normally had like 140 ping (on the east coast by the way). It also helps knowing if my lane opponent has like 14 ping to my 108 ping on the east coast.

so that people can talk shit to people who are actually lagging.
